org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read

Class ReservedTags

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.ReservedTags

  • public final class ReservedTags
extends java.lang.Object
    Reserved SAM tags for ReadTools. Some of the tags will be output to the final user, but some are just used internally.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ct
      Integer flag indicating if a read that is completely trimmed.
      static java.lang.String te
      Integer flag representing the end trim point for a read after trimming.
      static java.lang.String ts
      Integer flag representing the start trim point for a read after trimming.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • ts

        public static final java.lang.String ts
        Integer flag representing the start trim point for a read after trimming. It is used in combination with the te tag to trim a read. If te is present, the not trimmed read extends the range [ts, te); if not, [ts, read length).
        See Also:
        RTReadUtils.getTrimmingStartPoint(GATKRead), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingStartPointTag(GATKRead, int), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingPointTags(GATKRead, int, int), Constant Field Values

      • te

        public static final java.lang.String te
        Integer flag representing the end trim point for a read after trimming. It is used in combination with the ts tag to trim a read. If ts is present, the not trimmed read extends the range [ts, te); if not, [0, te).
        See Also:
        RTReadUtils.getTrimmingEndPoint(GATKRead), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingEndPointTag(GATKRead, int), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingPointTags(GATKRead, int, int), Constant Field Values

      • ct

        public static final java.lang.String ct
        Integer flag indicating if a read that is completely trimmed. If this flag is set to 0, the read is not completely trimmed; other values indicates that the read was trimmed. The values are implementation-dependent.
        See Also:
        RTReadUtils.isCompletelyTrimRead(GATKRead), RTReadUtils.updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag(GATKRead), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingPointTags(GATKRead, int, int), Constant Field Values
